title: About This Project
text:
Why build this?

Hear a lot from community orgs that they need the same data
Code makes it free, reproducible, and sustainable

title: About This Project
text:
How did we do this?
Everything that you see on this website is available for free.
This project was built to be copied; we hope it inspires you to do similar work. Please feel free to fork the repository, or consider submitting a pull request to improve the project.

title: About This Project
text:
Who are we?
Group of planning students at Penn

title: Data Sources
text:
All the data used in this project are publicly available. They are drawn from two primary sources: the American Community Survey, and the City of Philadelphia.
The City of Philadelphia makes most of its data available on Open Data Philly. Other sources are available through the City’s ArcGIS REST API, and still others through the City’s SQL Database.

title: Data Reports for Philly RCOs
text:
Welcome to the website!
The plan is to make this page interactive, with a full downloadable report for every RCO in the city.

title: Data Reports for Philly RCOs
text:
What is this?
This Quarto document is made interactive using Shiny. Interactive documents allow readers to modify parameters and see the results immediately. Learn more about Shiny interactive documents at https://quarto.org/docs/interactive/shiny/.
Download this button
